definition: to compete/to fight for/to rush to purchase
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Visible at that time, contend for effect bookman , furniture of snap up fine wood also is one of vogue.
sentences.chinese: 可见当时，争效文人，争购细木家具也是时尚之一了。

sentences.english: The shelves in the supermarket is full of items before the Christmas rush.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞争购热潮前超市市场的货架堆满了商品。

sentences.english: The post office reported a run on the new stamps.
sentences.chinese: 邮局对大家争购新邮票作了报道。

sentences.english: His paintings have become collectors' items.
sentences.chinese: 他的画已成为收藏家争购的对象。

sentences.english: There was a rush for the concert tickets.
sentences.chinese: 出现了争购音乐会入场券的热潮。

sentences.english: The shelves in the supermarket are full of items before the Christmas Rush.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞争购热潮前超市市场的货架堆满了商品。

definition: lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
lit. to loosen one's purse/fig. to give generously to help others
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
to compete to be first/to contest first place
to sell/to be on sale/to be sold
